intro: Streptocarpus erubescens, commonly known as the red-stemmed African violet, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its upright, hairy stems and velvety, dark green leaves. The plant produces clusters of showy, tubular flowers in shades of pink, purple, and red, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Streptocarpus erubescens is a popular choice for indoor gardening due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
